title: PV diagram - work for two processes

content.question: An ideal gas can be taken from State <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math> to State <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math> by thermodynamic processes <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> and <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>, as shown in the <math alttext="P V" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>PV</mi></math> diagrams. Process <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> is an isothermal compression, and Process <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> consists of an isobaric compression and an isovolumetric process. Which of the following best compares the work <math alttext="W sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>W</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> done on the gas in Process <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> to the work <math alttext="W sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>W</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> done on the gas in Process <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>?

choices.label: <math alttext="W sub 1 is greater than, open parenthesis, W sub 2 equals 0, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>W</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>></mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mi>W</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></math>

<math alttext="W sub 1 is greater than W sub 2, which is greater than 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>W</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>W</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>></mo><mn>0</mn></math>
<math alttext="W sub 1 equals W sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>W</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>W</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>
<math alttext="W sub 1 is less than W sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>W</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>W</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="W sub 1 is greater than W sub 2, which is greater than 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>W</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>W</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>></mo><mn>0</mn></math>

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
